text: "Köppäbävisan" is a song written and recorded by Bengt Pegefelt, releasing it as a single in 1980, scoring a major hit in Sweden topping the Swedish singles chart between 8 May-5 June 1981. The song also charted at Svensktoppen for 10 weeks between 5 April-14 June (in a time where no song was allowed to chart longer than 10 weeks), and even topped the chart.Svensktoppen - 1981 Written in Borlänge Dialect, the lyrics deals with a person threatening to jump into the Dal River if not getting a sausage. "Köppäbä" is a reference to the old name of Falun, Kopparberget, and not Kopparberg, as often believed. In 1981, the song was recorded by Curt Haagers on the album Santa Maria, and also for the children's album, Smurfarnas bästa. ==Charts== {| class="wikitable" !Chart (1981) !Peak position |- |Sweden |align="center"|1 |} == References == Category:Curt Haagers songs Category:Number-one singles in Sweden Category:1980 singles Category:Swedish songs Category:Swedish-language songs Category:1980 songs
